p: The Brazilian Society for Human Reproduction (SBRH), the Brazilian Society for Assisted Reproduction (SBRA), and the Latin American Network of Assisted Reproduction (REDLARA) also published statements concerning patients undergoing assisted reproductive treatments. The SBRH stressed that there is no cause for panic in pregnant women and urged that the ASRM recommendations for women undergoing or planning infertility treatments be followed. However, treatment plans should be individually discussed with physicians as postponing of treatments may, in some cases, reduce chances of success ( SBRH, 2020).
